title: krishnaverma
author: krishnaverma
content: Link to the newshttps://moneywreckers.com/edward-snowden-offers-to-become-twitters-ceo-in-exchange-for-bitcoin-pay/Interesting that a person applying for the CEO position of Twitter is asking for payment in Bitcoin. That is how strong bitcoin has become over the years. More adoption yet to come and we may see even the majority workforce in USA getting paid in bitcoin.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Interesting proposal from an interesting person, but let's be honest — the chances of this happening is next to zero. Even if Elon wanted it, it would be a regulatory nightmare for him.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on December 19, 2022, 05:09:44 PMInteresting proposal from an interesting person, but let's be honest — the chances of this happening is next to zero. Even if Elon wanted it, it would be a regulatory nightmare for him.I agree.In comparison to Elon, Snowden being in charge of Twitter would be a nightmare for many people in positions of power and holding security clearances in the USA government. For example, the are many people there who believe Social media owned by political adversaries is a threat to the national security (Tiktok is an usual case or this discussion).If Snowden took over, the Republican establishment would go crazy about it and the democrat establishment would question whether the Kremlin would try to influence the society in America through Twitter. On the other hand, There is a chance Musk considers his offer for the sole purpose of causing displeasure among his critics.

The question is, will Elon be willing to pay in btc, or would he rather pay him in dogecoin?   Lol, it seems to me this did this on purpose knowing Elon stands in btc. This is really interesting.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on December 19, 2022, 05:09:44 PMInteresting proposal from an interesting person, but let's be honest — the chances of this happening is next to zero. Even if Elon wanted it, it would be a regulatory nightmare for him.Think this is more of a marketing stunt from Edward Snowden, since he needs to stay in the media to keep making a living. Still it is a good thing that he proposes bitcoin payment, especially since a few people claim that bitcoin was created by the NSA   I think that makes this theory a lot more unlikely.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: I believe Twitter should not have a CEO that could do whatever he wishes. There should be some kind of board of directors to take the decisions in group  and this group should have multiple political point of views. I like Snowden, but I think a more neutral person and not so polemical would be better

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Is it only me who finds these polls made by Elon just desperate attempts for advertising his new toy (yes, Twitter) and keep some action going on there?I find a bit unlikely Elon will step down this quick - he might find some trick to get out of this dilemma he created for himself - and I also find it highly unlikely to make Twitter CEO people like Snowden or Snoop Dogg or others who would propose themselves as CEO.He desperately needs a solution, especially after he "restored the freedom" and then started disallowing this and that (including the most visible thing: the links to competition), and a new CEO could be the salvation he needs. But, again, I have some doubts he will do it.The only correct/hones thing in this shitshow is Elon's answer there: Quote from: https://nitter.it/elonmusk/status/1604621101245419520The question is not finding a CEO, the question is finding a CEO who can keep Twitter alive

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: I don't pay much attention to Elon's sensational tweets which are created for attention, nor is an average individual concerned with the administrative aspects of running Twitter. Quote from: electronicash on December 19, 2022, 06:35:24 PMSnowden offering as CEO might be a bit of crazy. But he might be able to make the Twitter more alive, Snowden must have lots of things to discuss in relation to free speech that's for sure.A CEO does not necessarily need to draw traffic through discussions, if Twitter needed that, it would be better of going for an influencer. Also, the success of a business, even a social media platform, is far more than building traffic and engagements.

comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: Yeah, I doubt Snowden’s application to step in as CEO of twitter would receive a second review. But it is interesting he’s opting for the job and more interesting, the choice to be paid in bitcoin. I think the fact that he sees bitcoin as a legit means of payment and is indirectly spreading the word about bitcoin is what’s note worthy. I personally don’t care who runs twitter as the CEO. Lately Elon, with his newfound incessant twitting habit has been  in my opinion, doing a poor job of running the app that anyone other than him would be better.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: That was just a joke, because it's not possible to put such proposal on practice. USA wouldn't accept Twitter accessible on their country if a man who is wanted by them is the CEO of the company. Probably allied nations would follow USA's lead on this matter, also forbidding Twitter right after. So, besides the currently financial issue Twitter is facing, they would have another one, besides worsening the financial status more yet.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on December 19, 2022, 05:03:27 PMMore adoption yet to come and we may see even the majority workforce in USA getting paid in bitcoin. Doubt.  Big doubt.Bitcoin is getting more adopted than ever before.  But this will not make Bitcoin the favorite choice of the majority.  States will not allow this to happen.  And it would be a huge disappointment and a big failure because imagine your salary ranged from $500 to $1,500 through out every 30 days instead of being set at a fixed $1,000.-----If Elon wants Twitter to fail, choosing Snowden as the new CEO is the way.  While Snowden said a lot of very important and interesting things, he is still seen by most people as some body sitting on Putin's lap.  Would be a big scandal nonetheless.-Regards,PrivacyG

comments.author: Captain Corporate
comments.body: And I am too. This is not even newsworthy, why the hell would Snowden be the new CEO, and why are we even discussing it. Like I would be too, and you wouldn't make it a news right? Because why would you? Why would some guy who is a random would be the CEO and be a news. I get that Snowden is a bit famous due to leaks and I get that, I understand that part but he is not a social media manager or anything like that, dude has NOTHING to do with being CEO, its like Lebron James or Ronaldo, or Gordon Ramsay said it, like absolutely irrelevant person. And we somehow still consider this news for some weird reason.
